benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Request scenarios: TC01, TC02, TC03 cover successful updates with required headers and valid body.
Header handling and auditing: TC01 (CreatedBy), TC02 (CreatedBy, Reason, Comment).
Create/update of custom fields: TC03 (no initial fields) and TC04 (empty array removal/no-op).
Error handling: TC05 (invalid paymentId format), TC06 (non-existent payment), TC07 (missing required header), TC08 (missing body), TC09 (malformed JSON), TC10 (invalid CustomField data).
Edge cases: TC14 (large number of fields), TC15 (max length values), TC16 (extra unexpected parameters).
Performance focus: TC19 (concurrent requests), TC20 (large payload size).
gaps: Pagination and large datasets: No explicit pagination tests for listing or retrieving fields via GET, though PUT-based tests touch large payloads in TC14/TC20, but no dedicated pagination tests for GET after update.
Authorization breadth: While TC11 covers unauthorized access, broader tests around token expiry/refresh or 403 for insufficient permissions are not present.
Rate limiting: No tests validating rate limiting/throttling on repeated PUT requests.
Caching behavior: No tests for ETag/Cache-Control/validation of caching headers specific to this PUT endpoint.

Partial update semantics: PUT normally implies full update; explicit test distinguishing partial vs full replacement is not clearly represented (no dedicated 204 vs 200 differentiation for partial changes).
Retry/fault tolerance scenarios beyond single 500 (e.g., transient failures with retries) are not covered.
recommendations: Add a dedicated set of tests for rate limiting and throttling on consecutive PUT requests to the same resource.
Add caching validation tests (ETag/Cache-Control) for PUT responses and conditional requests if applicable.
Extend authorization tests to include additional failure modes (e.g., expired tokens, insufficient permissions).
Clarify and test partial vs full update behavior for PUT vs PATCH semantics, potentially adding a dedicated test for partial updates or ensuring PUT is treated as full replacement.
Add explicit pagination tests for GET after multiple updates to validate consistent retrieval when datasets grow, and to cover large-number scenarios more formally.
